intro: Pavetta lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Pavetta lanceolata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
